8f3e9705bdd690c84cdb1f996c341f37 (15:16): I could imagin taking my current computer back to 1999
e3f8df0597e0078a57aa8c61163480ca (15:16): wasn`t even 5 1/4 standard I believe
8f3e9705bdd690c84cdb1f996c341f37 (15:17): People would be shocked
e3f8df0597e0078a57aa8c61163480ca (15:17): to see you or the computer
8f3e9705bdd690c84cdb1f996c341f37 (15:17): to see the speed
3da35941afbd862cad732140a2b52ac7 (15:17): heh I had a PII 450 with 128mb of ram in 1997
39e9cb412e970b3d5737c6709f3aef6e (15:17): I'm using ubuntu with both the KDE and Gnome desktops installed on a Sony Vaio PCG-fr215s Notebook.
39e9cb412e970b3d5737c6709f3aef6e (15:17): The Battery monitor isn't always visible (random after restart/shut down).
39e9cb412e970b3d5737c6709f3aef6e (15:17): Can anyone help me fix this so that it is visible 100% of the time?
3da35941afbd862cad732140a2b52ac7 (15:17): I could pretty much do anything I wanted
3da35941afbd862cad732140a2b52ac7 (15:17): Peter77: why are you asking in here?
8f3e9705bdd690c84cdb1f996c341f37 (15:17): I had a 120 mhz Cirix in 1997
3da35941afbd862cad732140a2b52ac7 (15:17): go bug the people in #ubuntu / #KDE / #Gnome
8f3e9705bdd690c84cdb1f996c341f37 (15:17): I had to make do
39e9cb412e970b3d5737c6709f3aef6e (15:18): Quiznos in linux chat said to ask here incase theres an issue with my laptop
3da35941afbd862cad732140a2b52ac7 (15:18): 128mb of ram in 1997 was like having 4gb of ram now
3da35941afbd862cad732140a2b52ac7 (15:18): keep in mind 16mb was the standard back then
3da35941afbd862cad732140a2b52ac7 (15:18): hell some people even made do with 8mb
8f3e9705bdd690c84cdb1f996c341f37 (15:19): I had that computer from 1997 to 2003
3da35941afbd862cad732140a2b52ac7 (15:19): even more impressive was that it was 128mb on one stick
8f3e9705bdd690c84cdb1f996c341f37 (15:19): you must be loaded
8f3e9705bdd690c84cdb1f996c341f37 (15:19): That would of cost a truck load
3da35941afbd862cad732140a2b52ac7 (15:19): company offer
8f3e9705bdd690c84cdb1f996c341f37 (15:22): I upgrade to a Pentium II 333 mhz pc in 2003
8f3e9705bdd690c84cdb1f996c341f37 (15:23): Was happy then. It was alot better than my cirix
3da35941afbd862cad732140a2b52ac7 (15:23): my pocket PC is more powerful than that
8f3e9705bdd690c84cdb1f996c341f37 (15:23): Then got my 2.4 ghz machine in 2005
8f3e9705bdd690c84cdb1f996c341f37 (15:23): Then this year I got my Intel Core 2 duo
8f3e9705bdd690c84cdb1f996c341f37 (15:24): ended up with about 10 1 ghz computers during 2005
8f3e9705bdd690c84cdb1f996c341f37 (15:24): buying and selling them
